value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 dataâ€‹
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Dataâ€‹

value.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

value.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: A technique to count anything in Power Query and some in DAX too
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you a technique to count any text in a cell in Power query and DAX.  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: How to do Pagination on a REST API in Power Query (Part 1)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how to implement pagination when the number of pages or records to be returned are known.   Chapters: 00:00 Intro 00:30 Not all APIs have the same structure 01:10 Get data from World Bank API 01:45 How pagination works on the API 02:30 Hardcode the number of pages

value.title: Can you refresh a single table in Power BI?
value.excerpt: Frustrated that a you can only do a full refresh? Patrick takes it to the next level by showing how you can refresh only a single table in your Power BI dataset. This is a great option for targeted refresh and avoid potential overhead.  Processing Options:  https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/multidimensional-models/processing-options-and-settings-analysis-services?view=asallproducts-allversions

value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!

value.title: SQL Server in Microsoft Fabric? Use CETaS to move data!
value.excerpt: People have been asking "What about SQL Server?" with regards to Microsoft Fabric. Bob Ward joins us to show a way you can get your SQL data into Fabric with CETaS and the power of shortcuts in OneLake. And, then use that data in Power BI!  CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE AS SELECT (CETAS) (Transact-SQL) https://learn.microsoft.com/sql/t-sql/statements/create-external-table-as-select-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver16&tabs=powershell
